  • Constructor Details

    • SwerveModuleBase

      public SwerveModuleBase(Vec2d position, double steeringRatio, double driveRatio)
      Represents a swerve module Designed to be inherited. Please override the setAngle() and setRawSpeed() methods at minimum.

      All angles are in radians. All length is in the unit of your choice

      Other things that you may want to include: - reset module position (set the current angle to 0) using absolute encoders - re-zero the steering motor using absolute encoders

      Parameters:
      position - the position of the module relative to the center of rotation
      steeringRatio - gear ratio of the steering motor
      driveRatio - gear ratio of the drive motor

    • SwerveModuleBase

      public SwerveModuleBase(Vec2d position, double steeringRatio, double driveRatio, boolean optimized)

  • Method Details

    • calculateNewAngleSetpoint

      public double calculateNewAngleSetpoint(double angle)
      calculates the angle to set the steering motor to
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle to set the steering motor to
      Returns:
      the angle to set the steering motor to

    • calculateOptimizedAngle

      public double calculateOptimizedAngle(double angle)
      "optimized" motor rotation: if the angle is greater than 90 degrees, rotate the motor in the opposite direction and rotate less than 90 degrees

    • calculateDesiredAngleWrapper

      public double calculateDesiredAngleWrapper(double angle)
      Calulates the angle to set the steering motor to. Wrapper for both calculateOptimizedAngle and calculateNewAngleSetpoint please use this instead of anything else

    • XLock

      public void XLock()
      "X-Locks" the modules points all of the wheels toward the center of the robot to make the robot harder to push not very useful if all of your swerve modules are colinear

    • setRawAngle

      public void setRawAngle(double angle)
      sets the angle of the module OVERRIDE ME!!! This is where you call your motor controllers
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle to set the module to
